data.title: Brian Kelm's Top Blues CDs
data.meta_description: The Utah Blues Society exists to preserve blues heritage, celebrate blues recording and performance, expand statewide awareness of the blues, and ensure the future of this uniquely American art form.
data.text:
By 90.9 FM KRCL “Red, White & Blues” host Brian Kelm

(Disclaimer - it should be noted that these are simply 15 of my favorite CD’s that came into KRCL and/or I otherwise came across. There are simply too many good blues CD’s out there for me to buy them all up! They are in chronological order by date, not by rating. Also, I am partial to electric blues but always include at least one acoustic CD!)

2024 - Top 15 Blues CD’s

Chris O’Leary – The Hard Line (Alligator 1-12-24)

Tinsley Ellis – Naked Truth (Alligator 2-9-24, I always include at least 1 acoustic CD!)

Altered Five Blues Band – Testifyin’ (Blind Pig 3-22-24)

Sue Foley - One Guitar Woman (Stony Plain 3-29-24)

Johnny Burgin – Ramblin’ From Coast to Coast (Straight Shooter 4-15-24)

Jeff Pitchell – Brown Eyed Blues (Deguello Records 5-1-24)

Toronzo Cannon – Shut Up & Play (Alligator 6-7-24)

JP Soars – Brick By Brick (Little Village 6-30-24)

2023 - Top 15 Blues CD’s

(actually, this year it's a "Sweet 16"!!)

The following were nominated for 2017 BMA’s (announced 1/9/17):

*Album; Contemporary Blues Album; Contemporary Blues Male Artist; Song (Gotta Walk It Off)

** Best Emerging Artist Album

***Best Emerging Artist Album; Soul Blues Female Artist

4* Album; Band; Contemporary Blues Album

5* Trad Blues Album

6* Album; Contemporary Blues Album; Contemporary Blues Male Artist

7* Historical Album (actually recorded in 1998 but just released this year!)

8* Koko Taylor Award (Trad Blues Female Artist)

9* Album; Soul Blues Album; Soul Blues Male Artist

10* Soul Blues Female Artist

11* Song (I Gotta Sang The Blues)

12* Wow, 10 nominations!...Album; BB King Entertainer; Song (Seeing Is Believing); Trad Blues Album; Trad Blues Male Artist; Band; Instrumentatalist-Harmonica; Guitar (Monster Mike Welch); Bass (Michael “Mudcat” Grant); Pinetop Perkins Piano (Anthony Geraci)
